meta.title: Gazprom Neft - Project: Professionals 4.0
meta.description: Project Professionals 4.0: CSSSR is in charge of developing the front-end, including the main page, performer and company dashboards, as well as the projects page.

hero.title: Professionals 4.0connects major corporations with talented contractors

text.firstParagraph: is a subsidiary of Gazprom operating in the oil and gas industry. As of 2020, its market capitalization comprises around $20 billion, making it one of the most influential and capitalized companies in Europe.

challenge.heading: The challenge
challenge.text: Gazprom Neft decided to build a platform to connect talented individuals to corporate projects that would require their unique skills. Its implementation saw several independent teams working in close collaboration under quick release cycles.

task.heading: The Task
task.text: Build the front-end of the platform that would enable a whole set of communications, technologies, processes, and services to facilitate the interaction between individuals and companies that may need their involvement.

months.description:
Months from MVP
to public release

quote.text: I would like to emphasize the professionalism and effectiveness of the CSSSR team in their solving complex problems and the commitment to meet all project plans and goals.
quote.author: Darya Skatova

team.title: Team Composition
team.description: We assembled a team of an Account Manager, a Project Manager, a Business Analyst, Developers, and Quality Assurance.

accountManagement.title: Account Management
text: Customer’s security checks, including financial soundness and employee reliability, successfully passed.
Over 400 pages of duly executed paperwork submitted in the tender proposal. This included the grading of developers, hourly fees, managerial staff details, and annual plans, among other things.
The account manager established proprietary channels of communication acting as an executive hub between the customer and the company.
The account manager delivered recurring reporting and schedules for shorter periods based on Project Management data.

projectManagement.title: Project Management
text: Our project manager interacted with the customer team in their preferred environment: Slack, Jira & Confluence
She ensured that all tasks within development phases are carried out timely or reasonably flexed.
The project manager suggested and supervised the transfer of some of the project’s logic from back-end to front-end to ensure the timely release of the features.

Our project manager used CSSSR’s in-house combination of Scrum and Kanban methodologies to ensure the timely delivery of quality products and worked in a shared space with the customer and other project teams.

businessAnalysis.title: Business Analysis
businessAnalysis.description: Our business analyst worked out the platform functionality requirements.
text: During the development process, she was working hand-by-hand with the client’s product manager helping to transform users’ stories into well-documented feature requests and technical specifications both for front-end and back-end parts of the project.
Understanding the needs of customers and candidates alike improved the initial concept for user experience and interface.
imagesText: Skills radar chart for easier evaluation of candidates by the customer
All the passed tests are represented as badges in the user’s profile
An option to set up automatic testing for candidates

quote.text: For over a year, we’ve been working with CSSSR on this project which is very important to our company and to me personally. I would like to emphasize the professionalism and effectiveness of the CSSSR team in solving complex problems and the commitment to meet all product plans and goals. The friendly atmosphere and rapport the CSSSR team helped to create also deserve my sincere commendation.

development.title: Development
text: Our developers used React / Next.js staсk to boost up the development progress rate. They also accelerated the website operation through server-side rendering (SSR).
The final product boasted low resource requirements and high speed of operation with SEO optimization implemented.

The development team created a single space for all project-related reference data to accelerate their operations. All agreements, guidelines, schedules, and code and components structure were placed in a single wiki-like database. That made the implementation of complex features faster and more efficient.
development.description: Our developers created and implemented some notable solutions to augment and accelerate the development cycle, including:

features.text: Meta tags, open graph, human-readable URLs for efficient SEO
Proprietary fork of an open-source chat service for faster inter-team interaction

assurance.heading: Quality Assurance
assurance.subheading: QA engineers ensured due quality testing under tight deadlines and frequent release schedules.
assurance.message: Our QA team worked along with the back-end QA team to create a seamless environment for cross-referencing of the tasks.
assurance.label: roi
assurance.description: profit margin from using test automation based on ROI calculations as compared to manual testing.
assurance.screenAlt: Two screens with a profile info
assurance.designerAlt: Project screen with two designers chatting
assurance.projectsAlt: Screen with a list of company projects

imgAlt.aboutProject: We assembled a team of four developers, which later enlarged to six.

meta.title: S7 Airlines - Project: Personal Account
meta.description: S7 Airline Customer's personal account: we have developed the entire front-end, written on Next.js, for the adaptive website of the project.

text.firstParagraph: S7 Airlines is the largest Russian domestic private airline primarily based at Moscow Domodedovo International Airport and Novosibirsk Tolmachevo Airport. S7 has the youngest fleet on the Russian air transportation market. It boasts an extensive network of routes allowing passengers to travel to 181 destinations in 26 countries all over the globe. S7 is a full member of Oneworld airline alliance.
text.secondParagraph: S7 Airlines is a part of S7 AirSpace Corporation, a major Russian holding consisting of 15 companies, doing business in passengers and cargo air transportation (both regular and charter), tourism, air flights ticket distribution, flight personnel training, aircraft repair, and other aviation and space services.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: S7 Airlines’ personal account provides quick access to the Airline’s services: customers can view their reservations and participate in the loyalty program.
We develop the entire front-end for the adaptive website of the project.

The core team consists of 4 developers and one QA Engineer, additional specialists were assigned at certain stages of the project development. The first public version was released at the end of 2018, since then, we keep working on its new functionality.

Currently we are implementing flight statistics and login through social networks, and are planning to conduct significant refactoring and improve the performance of the web application. The entire front-end is written on Next.js — a modern React framework.

imgAlt.aboutProject: We assembled a team of four developers, which later enlarged to six.

meta.title: Mosoblgaz — Project: Personal Account
meta.description: Development of b2b client's account that allows quick access to the company's services.

text.firstParagraph: Mosoblgaz is one of the largest gas distribution companies in Russia providing natural gas distribution throughout the Moscow Region. By using Mosoblgaz services one can apply for connection to gas networks, monitor the account balance and control gas consumption using his/her personal account on the website or in a mobile application.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: We have developed a personal account for legal entities, which allows to get quick access to Mosoblgaz services, forward documents for approval, get a detailed report on expenses or make a request to connect an object to the network.
The personal account supports role models and restrictions for individual employees.

imgAlt.aboutProject: We assembled a team of four developers, which later enlarged to six.

meta.title: Brusnika — Project: Internal assessment and forecasting tools
meta.description: Creation of internal sales planning tools for the company's managers.

text.firstParagraph: Brusnika — is a Russian development company specializing in the construction of multi-storey residential buildings in major cities of Siberia, the Urals and the Moscow Region.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: This case will be remembered for complex logic and almost complete lack of HTML coding.

We were engaged in the development of an internal sales planning tool for Brusnika managers. Our team used Node.js to integrate into the customer’s database and output sorted data. Work with «Sales Planning» is done in an interface similar to a table editor. Thanks to this tool the company’s employees can see the real estate price growth dynamics, verify information about past transactions and forecast the value of the real estate object for months ahead.

imgAlt.aboutProject: We assembled a team of four developers, which later enlarged to six.

quote.text: The result of our joint work was not only a software product, but also a new work style that we've developed with our colleagues. Thank you for your individual approach, courage throughout experiments and professionalism in difficult situations!

author.name: Kirill Makarkin
author.signature: Head of Managerial Projects Digitalization Group

meta.title: Mindbox  — Projects: Personal Account Data Filtering & Promotion Campaigns Arbitration
meta.description: Development of two projects for marketing automation.

hero.title: Personal Account Data Filtering / Promotion Campaigns Arbitration
hero.subTitle: Client

text.firstParagraph: Mindbox develops a customer data platform for marketing automation, implements, and helps use cloud solutions for retail marketing automation in FMCG, retail, e-commerce and other industries with large numbers of customers.
text.secondParagraph: Thanks to the platform, a client can personalize its website with dynamic content and recommendations, set up messages circulation via emails, social networks, and messengers, and ensure loyalty growth by creating virtual loyalty cards and promotions.

aboutProject.title: About the Projects:
text: We worked on two projects: development of a personal account data filtering system and a «Promotion Campaigns Arbitration» application development.
In the first project, we were faced with a non-trivial problem: we had to implement data filtering with an option to add new filters and combine them into groups in a tree structure.

Our team has developed a filtering system that supports conditions and nesting levels. After basic data sorting, a user can configure fine filtering, which enables a user to apply up to several thousand filters.

The second project also required development of a complex logic cooperating with a tree structure. Thanks to «Promotion Campaigns Arbitration» a Mindbox client can create new promotions, flexibly setting up rules of promotions interaction with each other by combining them into groups. Arbitrary nesting of groups is supported.

An unconventional drag-and-drop was developed by us for this application. For example, a user can create a «Promotions» group with subgroups «Discount», «Accrual of Points», «Gift with Purchase» and «Discount by Promotion Code», and configure the parameters of each entity.

imgAlt.aboutProject: We assembled a team of four developers, which later enlarged to six.

meta.title: QMarketing  —  Project: QAcademy
meta.description: Front-end development of internal pages for the e-learning platform.

text.firstParagraph: Qmarketing Agency develops progressive digital advertising for companies operating on the Russian and European markets, invests in technological projects, and creates its own training program for marketing specialists and entrepreneurs — QAcademy.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: Qmarketing Academy is an interactive system that trains to choose the most effective analytical and promotional tools. Beginner entrepreneurs, marketers, and CEOs are trained on the basis of real-life cases, have their knowledge gaps filled, and awarded certificates of successful course completion.

We were entrusted with front-end development of authorization page, user profile, interactive training block and certificate issuance page. Upon the development completion, our team integrated the developed pages with the customer's API.

imgAlt.aboutProject: We assembled a team of four developers, which later enlarged to six.

meta.title: Flant  —  Project: Landing Pages
meta.description: CSSSR was in charge of developming and testing of seven landing pages for the Flant comapny.

text.firstParagraph: Flant company is engaged in elaborating fault tolerant IT infrastructures on the basis of Kubernetes. It provides processes of continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD), 24/7/365 operation of applications. Flant is the first certified Kubernetes service provider in Russia.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: Our team was engaged in Flant landing pages elaborating. We developed and tested 7 pages, adapted them for viewing on any device, including Retina, and adjusted customer’s CRM application form.

imgAlt.aboutProject: Three people are working hard on the project.

quote.text: We had no time to warm up. We worked in a way that from page concept until its implementation beginning was literally one night. At such a pace, there was simply no room for experiments or organization of our own front-end development process. We needed a timely result with guaranteed quality. That’s why we didn’t think for a long time: we came to CSSSR as we repeatedly crossed paths with the guys’ work for the projects of our clients and understood very well what output we will get. It’s cool that all our expectations of the result were fully met. Moreover, the CSSSR framework allowed us to further develop the project on our own (though at a much slower pace). Investments in a stormy start with CSSSR still justify themselves up to now.
